channel.title: Mark Zuckerberg, Bill Gates and many more presents: Code.org
channel.description:
Yesterday Mark Zuckerberg (creator of Facebook) linked this video about coding. I have watched the video and I have to admit it looks interesting. Perhaps this is something interesting for the newbies out there?
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tVtvCAYBhTg[/youtube]

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg, Bill Gates and many more presents: Code.org

Very neat, went too that website did every java course xD 100% in no time wasted…

item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

The kids who could truly benefit from this won’t even take advantage. No hood rat kid is going to go on code.org in his library and start to learn.

Read full topic
item.source: Mark Zuckerberg, Bill Gates and many more presents: Code.org

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg, Bill Gates and many more presents: Code.org
item.dc:creator: @Jaded Jaded
item.description:
@Jaded wrote:

Tutorial:

It’s very disappointing that the closest course to computer science in my school is a course that teaches you how to use basic applications, like Microsoft and Adobe products. The only resource I have to computer science information is the Internet, and although the Internet is very broad, it is usually better in most cases if you have someone with past experience to guide you through your progression of the course.

I agree. From my experience with coding, it really teaches you how to think in a more proper way. Coding is like math, but way more funny. Next year I will be studying Java partly so that will be cool!

Read full topic
item.source: Mark Zuckerberg, Bill Gates and many more presents: Code.org

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg, Bill Gates and many more presents: Code.org
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

I retract my former statement. Our educated workforce is cheaper compared to many other rich countries, but our low-income work is much better paid compared to our neighbors. You can earn $23 an hour by peeling bananas. Still, less competition leads to more profits.

Read full topic
item.source: Mark Zuckerberg, Bill Gates and many more presents: Code.org

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg, Bill Gates and many more presents: Code.org
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:16, topic:498368”][quote author=Christmas_tree link=topic=616598.msg4244041#msg4244041 date=1361997411]

Why can’t I sign the petition saying that I disagree with the idea?

I also disagree with the idea. However, they teach people french, and programming imo is easier than french…

That is not my point. It is all about our economy. It is quite hard for Norwegian companies to compete in the global marketplace. If some or our competition (United States) increase the amount of workers with higher education, it would get much harder for us.

Everything links back to the National Minimum Wage and the complete removal of a working class
[/quote]
What do you mean?[/quote]

No working class = no cheap labor. Cheap labor is exported out the country. No cheap labor = no working class. Nmw = no cheap labor. No labor, no jobs. Jobs that are left require an education. No working class = every single person living in the EU or the US being put through some form of an education to the point where at some level everyone is equal. Working class were on a much lower level of equal. Post-nmw, every tom, dick and fucking harry is looking for a job

Read full topic
item.source: Mark Zuckerberg, Bill Gates and many more presents: Code.org

Everything links back to the National Minimum Wage and the complete removal of a working class[/quote]
What do you mean?

item.dc:creator: @Jaded Jaded
item.description:
@Jaded wrote:

imthenull:

I watched it yesterday, I’m glad i took the initiative to learn programming at such a young age (14), all thanks to moparscape

Same here! Tho, I learned some basic HTML because my server partner needed a HTML developer in the team, so that got me into HTML.

Code.org lead me into a good video tutorial about how to javascript. This guy that is teaching, is totally amazing. He is explaining very simple but not too simple. If anyone would like to see the videos, just send me a PM
